NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
OFFICE OF THE PRESIDENT
Box 2002
University, Alabama
May 15, 1953
Mr* Frank Schooley
Room 119 Gregory Hall
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Frank:
The enclosed carbon of my reply to George Overton's letter
is self-explanatory. If you have not already sent the agreement on
the Big Four and on the new $80,000.00 grant to Scotty, you may wish
to send it to George first* His letter indicated that he is expecting
it* However, use your own discretion on this.
You have received by now the copy of my letter to Bill
Griffiths covering the fellowships, scholarships, internships deal.
In a telephone conversation with him yesterday he indicated that he
expected these to be a specific request from NAEB - a direct contraÂ¬
diction to Hull's statement that my form of helpful interest and
offer of help was very good. He indicated interest in receiving
as soon as possible a complete spelling out of the details of all
the proposals which we might include, such as a specific statement
of the amount of each of the proposals which would go to scholarships
and the amount of each proposal which would go to cover the cost
of operating each of the se workshops .or seminars. In the case of
the engineering thing, for instance, Wfcwanted to know what portion
of the $9,000.00 we anticipated spending for tuition, if any, and
what portion we anticipated contributing directly to those who attend
the training sessions. I promised to get this breakdown of details
to him as soon as possible,, and this is a request for you to get
busy on those details as rapidly as possible to the extent of:
1. Contacting already established workshops and
building a list of such, including tuition and dates.
2. Contacting several institutions to see if they would
be interested in holding any of the proposed seminars,
how much (if any) they would expect for local fees,
how much would be needed to bring in additional
consultants or teachers, and how much it would cost
to house and feed the crowd in each case.
3. Making an estimate of the amount which will be necessary
for travel for each person attending these places.
